Package com.github.jonathanxd.iutils.container

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BaseContainer<T>
    Containers is a value holder, Containers make easy to modify values that needs be final, example: int x = 0; Consumer<Integer> consumer = (i) -> { x += 1; }; The value X needs to be "Local variable x defined in an enclosing scope must be final or effectively final"
    A way to solve this is using Container, see example using Container final Container<Integer> x = Container.of(0); Consumer<Integer> consumer = (i) -> { x.set(x.get()+1); }; also for int you can use IntContainer final IntContainer x = new IntContainer(0); Consumer<Integer> consumer = (i) -> { x.add(); };
    HistoryContainer<T>
    Created by jonathan on 21/02/16.
    IMutableContainer<T>  
    Mutability
    Created by jonathan on 27/02/16.
    UnknownContainer<T>
    Container that has only getter and setter link methods.
